intro: Cleisocentron kinabaluense, commonly known as the Kinabalu starling tree, is a rare flowering plant native to the high elevations of Mount Kinabalu in Borneo. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees, and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers. The plant is notable for its medicinal properties, with various parts used in traditional remedies. It thrives in the cool, humid climate of montane forests, often growing on rocky substrates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
